trans-unit.source: Defines the metadata attribute that specifies how an ASP.NET server control property or event is persisted to an ASP.NET page at design time.
This class cannot be inherited.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
The Web page designer in Visual Studio does not support the `ResetPropertyName` method that is optionally exposed by Windows Forms controls for property persistence.
Server controls are serialized using methods provided by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlPersister> class.

The implementation of these methods is driven by metadata attributes such as <xref:System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute>, <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute>, and <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode"></xref> value to assign to <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute.Mode"></xref>.
mode is not one of the values.
Specifies that the property or event persists in the opening tag of the server control as an attribute.
This field is read-only.
Specifies the default type for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute"></xref> class.
The default is `PersistenceMode.Attribute`.
This field is read-only.
Specifies that a property is HTML-encoded and persists as the only inner content of the ASP.NET server control.
This field is read-only.
Compares the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute"></xref> object against another object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute.Equals%2A> method first compares the current object with the given object and returns `true` if they are equal.

Otherwise, if the given object is also a <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute> object and is not `null`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute.Mode%2A> properties of each object are compared for equality and the result returned.
The object to compare to.
`true` if the objects are considered equal; otherwise, `false`.
Provides a hash value for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute"></xref> attribute.
The hash value to be assigned to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute"></xref>.
Specifies that a property persists as the only inner content of the ASP.NET server control.
This field is read-only.
Specifies that the property persists as a nested tag within the opening and closing tags of the server control.
This field is read-only.
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute"></xref> object is of the default type.

This method performs calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute.Equals%2A> method while passing in the object referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute.Default> property.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute"></xref> is of the default type; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the current value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode"></xref> enumeration.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode"></xref> that represents the current value of the enumeration.
This value can be `Attribute`, `InnerProperty`, `InnerDefaultProperty`, or `EncodedInnerDefaultProperty`.
The default is `Attribute`.
